definition: genuine goods at fair prices/(fig.) genuine/real/true

sentences.english: The only moral tenet governing the conduct of business in the shop was that the goods should be genuine and the price fair.
sentences.chinese: 货真价实，是商店唯一的道德。

sentences.english: He's just got Napoleon's personality through and through.
sentences.chinese: 他只是拥有货真价实的拿破仑人格。

sentences.english: Please tell us you've got a bona-fide lightsaber in the works.
sentences.chinese: 请向我保证说货真价实的光剑已经在研制中了。

sentences.english: Oh no, they are authentic paper carvings.
sentences.chinese: 哎，这是货真价实的刻纸。

sentences.english: This hotel is basically built into a cave in Farmington, N.M., just southeast of the four corners.
sentences.chinese: 这家旅馆建在新墨西哥州的一处货真价实的洞穴里。

sentences.english: His thesis on the orgin of blues is original.
sentences.chinese: 他关于蓝调的论文可是货真价实的原作。

sentences.english: You can find real treasures at consignment shops. Items are often new, if not gently used.
sentences.chinese: 在寄售店，你或许能找到货真价实的宝贝。

sentences.english: Tenfu's tea products are with quality goods and reasonable prices .
sentences.chinese: 天福茗茶产品品质保证，货真价实。

definition: replacement guaranteed if not genuine/fig. authentic
not just in name only, but also in reality (idiom)
that's just the way it is/exactly!
best quality/item of the highest quality/(slang) outrageous/annoying in the extreme/gross/person with these qualities
lit. name is not in vain (idiom); a fully justified reputation/enjoys a well-deserved reputation
to be worthy of/to deserve to be called/to prove oneself to be
lit. from head to tail (idiom); thoroughgoing/through and through/out and out/from top to bottom
